Description: Mathis Vogel - excommunicated priest - escapes from a psychiatric hospital , where he was previously . Everywhere he sees signs of sinfulness and ready at any price to fight them . Thus he writes in one of the themed stories magazines containing many scenes of violence and sadomasochism . Publisher also engaged theatrical productions Black Masses with all accompanying elements - naked female body , reading prayers in the name of Satan , etc. Watching these notions , Vogel sees them theatricality and staging, but sees them as a reality and eventually goes mad , and then begins to kill the girls who participated in this show.This brutal film with a brutal plot. While all this sounds pretty far-fetched, the film is inherent in a strange sense of realism . " Sadist of Notre Dame " (The Sadist of Notre Dame) is a cruelty that it lacks in budget options. There are quite a few sequences that contain heavy torture and mutilation, derived from the perverted sexual connotation . Franco at his best , in other words ,One of the major films Jess Franco. Rather than play a cameo role , as he often did , he took a leading role sadistic priest who fearlessly goes to murder to rid the world of evil. Franco attacks on the Catholic Church, made ??this tape , led to the fact that he, along with Luis Bunuel (Luis Bunuel), has been recognized by the Vatican as "the most dangerous director in the world " This is the most complete version of the film . The original version of the film was released in 1974 , but later , with the weakening of censorship , Jesus Franco added movie erotic scenes and released under the name " Seksortsizm ." A little later , by 1979, Franco again remade the film , changing some of the scenes , rewriting dialogue and reshoot the ending. This version has a " Ripper of Notre Dame " (The Ripper of Notre Dame) in 1979.
